Fugitive who pulled off Cleveland bank heists identified 52 years later

stories.text:
Last night I had a dream. (No, this isn't a parable; I literally dreamed this).

People wore a VR rig that could also monitor their vital signs. Facebook[1] used this to drive "engagement" - the more oxygen the user consumed, the more engaged they are.

That is, engagement was driven to the point that it became a physically measurable load on the user. "Engagement" was literally sapping peoples' physical energy.

Just a dream? Facebook's rebrand and stated new direction seem to indicate that they're going in this direction. (They might not take it this far, of course. Then again, they might.)

-----

[1] I say "Facebook", even though in my dream I never saw a logo or a brand on the UI. It looked like a FB-style feed, though.
stories.title: Tell HN: Dream/Nightmare of “Engagement”
